|   [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) is free software designed for statistical computing and graphics. *R* can be run in several user interfaces (GUI), among which [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/) stands out, an integrated development environment (IDE) that is also free. *Rstudio* also has a free *online version*, accessible via the website [RStudio Cloud](https://rstudio.cloud/).


## Quantitative Biochemistry & R

|       To access the content developed with **R** and **RStudio** for **Biochemistry** and related topics, you can alternatively download an [ebook](.\biqR.pdf) of the material (*in Portuguese*), or access the topics individually below, more updated. In this case, it is possible to reproduce the activities on any topic covered, simply by clicking on the top right corner of the code snippet containing a copy icon ![ copy ](icon_copiar.png){width=2%}, and pasting it in an installed *RStudio* session, or in its *online* version [RStudio Cloud](https://login.rstudio.cloud/). This [**quick tutorial**](https://youtu.be/LF99kO8DE6Y){target="\_blank"} in *video* illustrates the tip.
